abstract: Sinopec’s proposal to buy a Canadian oil company would be China’s largest cross-border energy deal and its second-largest cross-border deal of any kind, according to Dealogic.
snippet: Sinopec’s proposal to buy a Canadian oil company would be China’s largest cross-border energy deal and its second-largest cross-border deal of any kind, according to Dealogic.
lead_paragraph: China’s deal machine revved up Wednesday as Sinopec agreed to acquire the international oil producer Addax Petroleum for $7.2 billion.

headline.main: China’s Dealmakers Are Looking Abroad Again
